parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Force the speed limit on given object (object will never attempt to move faster than given by forceSpeed). Use negative value to return to default behaviour. Used unit is m/s. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''forceSpeed''' speed </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]] (in m/s) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_helicopter [[forceSpeed]] 150;</code></value></part><part><name/>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[forceWalk]], [[isWalking]], [[isForcedWalk]], [[getSpeed]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 17:02, 2 March 2007 (CET)
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Donnervogel|Donnervogel]]'''<dd class="note">Setting forceSpeed to -1 will make the unit move according to the group speed mode (often specified by the waypoint) again. Setting forceSpeed to 0 will halt the unit ignoring waypoints or orders.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 9 February 2008
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]'''
<dd class="note">Does not seem to do ''anything'' at the current time (V1.08.5163)

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 14 December 2011
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Igneous01|Igneous01]]'''
<dd class="note">If a unit (man) has forceSpeed set to anything under jogging (walking only) the unit will refuse to get into vehicles. He will automatically be unassigned from a vehicle everytime he is ordered to get in (via scripts or direct action)

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 1, 2020 - 03:21 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:TMZulu|TMZulu]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command must be executed on the client to which the object/unit is local and will only take effect where the unit is local. If locality changes, the command must be reapplied.
</dd>
</dl>
